description:
The Lake Laurentian Conservation area consists of 950 hectares (2400 acres) of protected green space just minutes from downtown Sudbury. This trail winds through mixed forest to the top of Mount Ramsey.  There is a scenic lookout partway up and then some very good views Ramsey Lake and of the Conservation area from the peak of Mt Ramsey
For more info check out http://www.rainbowroutes.com/index.php/routes/lake-laurentian-conservation-area/
directions: Turn onto Ramsey Lake road at Science north and travel for 2km to the turnoff for South Bay road. Follow South Bay road past the conservation area turn off and continue .5 km untill you get to the parking area at the Boi Ski Chalet
title: LLCA Mt. Ramsey Trail
